name: Maryam Mehrnezhad
content: Maryam Mehrnezhad - Royal Holloway Research Portal © C Maryam Mehrnezhad Dr Reader in Information Security, Department of Information Security https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4223-6885 EmailMaryam.Mehrnezhadrhul.acuk TW20 0EX Personal profile Personal profileDr Maryam Mehrnezhad is a Reader in Information Security Department, Royal Holloway University of London (RHUL), UK, joined in September 2022. Before that, she was a Senior Lecturer (Associate Professor) in the Secure and Resilient Systems (SRS) group, Newcastle University, UK, and a Visiting Professor at ETH Zurich, Switzerland, in 2022. Between 2016 and 2022, she was a tenured track Research Fellow (Research Assistant), at Newcastle University, UK. For more information, please visit her homepage:  https://sites.google.com/view/maryammjd/home Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all. This person’s work contributes towards the following SDG(s): Collaborations and top research areas from the last five years Recent external collaboration on country/territory level.
